Key.Original: Time after JIP are killed and moved to respawn (minutes)
Key.English: Time after JIP are killed and moved to respawn (minutes)

Key.Original: Ticket count for either the entire side or each player on that side
Key.English: Ticket count for either the entire side or each player on that side

Key.Original: "SQF Gearscript": Requires two variables to be set: "tunres_Respawn_Role," which serves as a parameter, and "tunres_Respawn_GearPath," which denotes the file path. "Potato Tool": Simply invokes its own function. "Save gear": Loads the same loadout saved at mission start, or it can be updated during the mission using the "tunres_Respawn_fnc_savegear" function. None: No gear scripts are executed. Players will spawn without any gear. Utilize the event handler "tunres_respawn_EH_unitRespawned" to provide gear.
Key.English: "SQF Gearscript": Requires two variables to be set: "tunres_Respawn_Role," which serves as a parameter, and "tunres_Respawn_GearPath," which denotes the file path. "Potato Tool": Simply invokes its own function. "Save gear": Loads the same loadout saved at mission start, or it can be updated during the mission using the "tunres_Respawn_fnc_savegear" function. None: No gear scripts are executed. Players will spawn without any gear. Utilize the event handler "tunres_respawn_EH_unitRespawned" to provide gear.

Key.Original: "Endless waves": Endless waves. "Side tickets": Side shares a ticket pool. Player tickets": Each player has their own ticket pool.
Key.English: "Endless waves": Endless waves. "Side tickets": Side shares a ticket pool. Player tickets": Each player has their own ticket pool.

Key.Original: Enable this camera mode for spectators
Key.English: Enable this camera mode for spectators

Key.Original: Activate Respawn System for the mission.
Key.English: Activate Respawn System for the mission.

Key.Original: Enable checking remaining tickets from this location.
Key.English: Enable checking remaining tickets from this location.

Key.Original: Only forced respawn waves. No timer involved.
Key.English: Only forced respawn waves. No timer involved.

Key.Original: If the remaining respawn time is less than the specified percentage here, the player will skip the next wave. For example, if the wave interval is 20 minutes and this is set to 50%, and a player dies when there are less than 10 minutes remaining until the next respawn, the player will skip the next wave and needs to wait for the following one. Set to 0 to disable this feature.
Key.English: If the remaining respawn time is less than the specified percentage here, the player will skip the next wave. For example, if the wave interval is 20 minutes and this is set to 50%, and a player dies when there are less than 10 minutes remaining until the next respawn, the player will skip the next wave and needs to wait for the following one. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

Key.Original: Range for Waiting Area. Default is 100m.
Key.English: Range for Waiting Area. Default is 100m.
Allow this side to be spectated
Key.Original: Allow this side to be spectated

Key.English: Respawn wave for __%1__. %2 units respawned. Total respawn count is %3.
Key.Original: Respawn wave for __%1__. %2 units respawned. Total respawn count is %3.

Key.English: Respawn wave for __%1__. %2 units respawned. Total respawn count is %3 and tickets left %4.
Key.Original: Respawn wave for __%1__. %2 units respawned. Total respawn count is %3 and tickets left %4.

Key.English: To use a custom texture, provide the path to it in a non-string format. If left empty or if an invalid path is given, the default side color will be used.
Key.Original: To use a custom texture, provide the path to it in a non-string format. If left empty or if an invalid path is given, the default side color will be used.

Key.English: After enabling, you can click on the map during the briefing, and it will create contest area markers.
Key.Original: After enabling, you can click on the map during the briefing, and it will create contest area markers.

Key.English: You can check remaining tickets from MSP using ACE actions.
Key.Original: You can check remaining tickets from MSP using ACE actions.

Key.English: You can check remaining tickets from the main base (flagpole) using ACE actions.
Key.Original: You can check remaining tickets from the main base (flagpole) using ACE actions.

Key.English: You are going to skip the next respawn wave.
Key.Original: You are going to skip the next respawn wave.

Key.English: Check respawn time until the next wave
Key.Original: Check respawn time until the next wave
Mission is using only forced waves.
Key.English: Mission is using only forced waves.

Key.Original: Place this module where you want the respawn point to be for this side.
Key.English: Place this module where you want the respawn point to be for this side.

Key.Original: Choose the side for this spawn point
Key.English: Choose the side for this spawn point

Key.Original: The Respawn Position module does not have a side set.
Key.English: The Respawn Position module does not have a side set.

Key.Original: There is already a '%1' marker. You either have multiple respawn point modules with the same settings or a marker named that. Either way, please remove it.
Key.English: There is already a '%1' marker. You either have multiple respawn point modules with the same settings or a marker named that. Either way, please remove it.

Key.Original: Marker icon must be in a non-string format. Default: hd_start
Key.English: Marker icon must be in a non-string format. Default: hd_start

Key.Original: Create a marker for this teleporter for the enabled sides.
Key.English: Create a marker for this teleporter for the enabled sides.

Key.Original: When enabled, it will use ACE interaction. Otherwise, it will use addAction.
Key.English: When enabled, it will use ACE interaction. Otherwise, it will use addAction.

Key.Original: Condition to enable/disable opening teleport menu. Must return true or false. Default: true
Key.English: Condition to enable/disable opening teleport menu. Must return true or false. Default: true

Key.Original: Condition to enable/disable TP location. (Code) Default: True
Key.English: Condition to enable/disable TP location. (Code) Default: True

Key.Original: Is this side allowed to use this teleporter?
Key.English: Is this side allowed to use this teleporter?

Key.Original: Classname for the object where the action to teleport is. Non-string format: Land_Sleeping_bag_blue_folded_F
Key.English: Classname for the object where the action to teleport is. Non-string format: Land_Sleeping_bag_blue_folded_F

Key.Original: There is already a '%1' marker. You either have multiple Waiting Area modules with the same settings or a marker named that. Please remove it.
Key.English: There is already a '%1' marker. You either have multiple Waiting Area modules with the same settings or a marker named that. Please remove it.

Key.Original: The Waiting Area module does not have a side set
Key.English: The Waiting Area module does not have a side set

Key.Original: Place this module where you want the respawn waiting area to be for this side.
Key.English: Place this module where you want the respawn waiting area to be for this side.

Key.Original: Choose the side for this waiting area
Key.English: Choose the side for this waiting area

Key.Original: Create a briefing tab displaying all these settings.
Key.English: Create a briefing tab displaying all these settings.

Key.Original: When enabled, the wave interval time will be shown in the briefing notes.
Key.English: When enabled, the wave interval time will be shown in the briefing notes.

Key.Original: When enabled, the starting ticket count will be shown in the briefing notes.
Key.English: When enabled, the starting ticket count will be shown in the briefing notes.

Key.Original: When enabled, the respawn type will be shown in the briefing notes.
Key.English: When enabled, the respawn type will be shown in the briefing notes.

Key.Original: Show this side for all. Own side is always shown, if 'show tickets' is enabled. Also, if that is disabled, none of the sides' tickets are shown.
Key.English: Show this side for all. Own side is always shown, if 'show tickets' is enabled. Also, if that is disabled, none of the sides' tickets are shown.

Key.Original: The mission has unlimited tickets for each side.
Key.English: The mission has unlimited tickets for each side.

Key.Original: The mission has limited tickets for each side.
Key.English: The mission has limited tickets for each side.

Key.Original: The mission has limited tickets for each player.
Key.English: The mission has limited tickets for each player.

Key.Original: The mission only uses forced respawn waves, so there is no respawn timer.
Key.English: The mission only uses forced respawn waves, so there is no respawn timer.

Key.Original: JIP players will be killed and moved to respawn after %2min from mission start. If a player disconnects earlier, it won't use a ticket.
Key.English: JIP players will be killed and moved to respawn after %2min from mission start. If a player disconnects earlier, it won't use a ticket.

Key.Original: JIP players are not killed and moved to respawn when they join the game.
Key.English: JIP players are not killed and moved to respawn when they join the game.

Key.Original: Once the MSP is deployed, it will report the presence of enemies within a %3 meter radius every %2 seconds.
Key.English: Once the MSP is deployed, it will report the presence of enemies within a %3 meter radius every %2 seconds.

Key.Original: The MSP's enemy reporting feature is disabled for this mission.
Key.English: The MSP's enemy reporting feature is disabled for this mission.

Key.Original:
MSP contested status is updated every %2s.
It will be contested if there are more enemies inside a %3m radius or even if one enemy is %4m away from it.
Key.English:
MSP contested status is updated every %2s.
It will be contested if there are more enemies inside a %3m radius or even if one enemy is %4m away from it.

Key.Original: This mission has delayed respawn on. If there is less than %2min (%3%5 from %4min) remaining until the next wave, you will skip it.
Key.English: This mission has delayed respawn on. If there is less than %2min (%3%5 from %4min) remaining until the next wave, you will skip it.

Key.Original: This mission has delayed respawn off.
Key.English: This mission has delayed respawn off.

Key.Original: Mobile Spawn Point (MSP) has been enabled for your side in this mission.
Key.English: Mobile Spawn Point (MSP) has been enabled for your side in this mission.

Key.Original: Mobile Spawn Point (MSP) has been enabled for this mission, but your side does not have MSP.
Key.English: Mobile Spawn Point (MSP) has been enabled for this mission, but your side does not have MSP.

Key.Original:
If there is an MSP or custom teleport points in this mission, you can access the teleport menu from the Main Base and uncontested MSP using the ACE action menu.
Custom teleport points might have different conditions and use either the vanilla action menu or ACE action menu, depending on how the mission maker has it set up.
Key.English:
If there is an MSP or custom teleport points in this mission, you can access the teleport menu from the Main Base and uncontested MSP using the ACE action menu.
Custom teleport points might have different conditions and use either the vanilla action menu or ACE action menu, depending on how the mission maker has it set up.

Key.Original: Time it takes to deploy MSP (seconds)
Key.English: Time it takes to deploy MSP (seconds)

Key.Original: Time it takes to pack MSP (seconds)
Key.English: Time it takes to pack MSP (seconds)

Key.Original: [['MSP has been contested!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]
Key.English: [['MSP has been contested!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]

Key.Original: [['MSP has been secured!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]
Key.English: [['MSP has been secured!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]

Key.Original: [['MSP has been deployed!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]
Key.English: [['MSP has been deployed!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]

Key.Original: [['MSP has been packed!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]
Key.English: [['MSP has been packed!'], ['Respawn position has been updated.']]

Key.Original: Put the vehicle classname which will be used as MSP. All vehicles of that type can be used as MSP. Use the non-string version of the classname like: B_MRAP_01_F. Only one type of vehicle is supported currently.
Key.English: Put the vehicle classname which will be used as MSP. All vehicles of that type can be used as MSP. Use the non-string version of the classname like: B_MRAP_01_F. Only one type of vehicle is supported currently.

Key.Original: When there are enemies inside this radius, MSP is always disabled, even if there are more friendlies within the maximum range (in meters), for this side.
Key.English: When there are enemies inside this radius, MSP is always disabled, even if there are more friendlies within the maximum range (in meters), for this side.

Key.Original: Interval for when the server updates the contested status for MSP, for this side
Key.English: Interval for when the server updates the contested status for MSP, for this side

Key.Original: Radius where there need to be more enemies than allies to disable MSP (meters), for this side
Key.English: Radius where there need to be more enemies than allies to disable MSP (meters), for this side

Key.Original: Range from MSP where enemies are reported (meters), for this side
Key.English: Range from MSP where enemies are reported (meters), for this side

Key.Original: Interval when the server checks if there are enemies near MSP, for this side
Key.English: Interval when the server checks if there are enemies near MSP, for this side

Key.Original: Enable Reporting Enemies near MSP, for this side
Key.English: Enable Reporting Enemies near MSP, for this side

Key.Original: Who receives notifications when MSP is contested?
Key.English: Who receives notifications when MSP is contested?

Key.Original: Who should be notified when enemies are near MSP?
Key.English: Who should be notified when enemies are near MSP?

Key.Original: When MSP is deployed or packed up, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader
Key.English: When MSP is deployed or packed up, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader

Key.Original: When MSP is contested, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader
Key.English: When MSP is contested, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader

Key.Original: When enemies are near MSP, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader
Key.English: When enemies are near MSP, who will receive notifications from it. Default: Group Leader
